Module kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem
Package kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.util

Class ErrorHandler

java.lang.Object
kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.util.ErrorHandler
public final class ErrorHandler extends Object
Static helper class for handling user input. Implements a Chain of Responsibility design pattern to pass input through a series of handlers. Provides other methods to check for business logic.
Author:
Timothy Albert Kline

  • Method Details

    • processInput

      public static boolean processInput(TextFieldContainer textFieldInfo)
      Helper function to pass a TextFieldContainer fields to class function processInput()
      Parameters:
      textFieldInfo - the TextFieldContainer to process
      Returns:
      true, if input was valid; false, otherwise.
      See Also:
      • processInput(String, TextFieldContainer.InputType, Text)

    • validateIntInputs

      public static boolean validateIntInputs(int stock, int min, int max, javafx.scene.text.Text stockFeedback, javafx.scene.text.Text minFeedback, javafx.scene.text.Text maxFeedback)
      Checks business logic for the stock level range and its current level; displays errors in UI. The current inventory level of an item must be between its min and max capacity. The range values must be set so that the min is less than the max.

      POST-COND: (side effect) Modifies Text associated with the user's input to display feedback/help for incorrect logic. Disables its visibility otherwise.

      Parameters:
      stock - the stock of the item
      min - the minimum stock level
      max - the maximum stock level
      stockFeedback - the feedback for the stock input
      minFeedback - the feedback for the min input
      maxFeedback - the feedback for the max input
      Returns:
      true, if inputs were logical. false, otherwise.

    • isInteger

      public static boolean isInteger(String input)
      Parses a String to verify if the whole String contains only numeric values
      Parameters:
      input - the string to check
      Returns:
      true, if the string is an integer; false, otherwise.
